data.title: Some resource_queue.gd issues in 3.0
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
3.0 latest compiled

**Issue description:**
I'm using the latest resource_queue.gd from the latest docs: 
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/learning/features/misc/background_loading.html

W/o touching anything and following the step by step guide, you get:
![](https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/RCerHoVwlrc0vcEvZcvm5P46WxvYQ9TAbUKRR6QIQ4s/https/i.gyazo.com/2c8f23c7acb9bc4988e7c0a2ef9d8da1.png)

`Parser Error: Identifier not found: VS`

However, if you remove that line, the thing actually works. Except..when you do `get_progress` it will return:
`-nan(ind)`

So prob not a good idea to do that lol, and I don't know if that line is a correlation to the `-nan(ind)` issue

data.title: Material: fix priority not int
data.body:
Fixes #11162

data.title: Fix duplication of nodes resulting in shared metadata
data.body:
Fixes #9547.

We should consider cleaning some of the code duplication, as we currently have 3 or more functions dealing with duplicating nodes in 2 different files.

data.title: Expand Margin for StyleBoxTexture clips box, but only with a Tree node?
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot_v3.0-alpha1_win64.exe.zip 
and
Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
![tree](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10387670/30261565-1b25b832-9682-11e7-9c19-7d1d6d9f67d4.PNG)

For some reason when using the `Bottom` property under Expand Margin in a StyleBoxTexture, it cuts off the bottom part of the StyleBox. And what's even more odd, it only happens when using a `Tree` node. It works perfectly fine under a Panel node and other nodes that let you use a custom `StyleBoxTexture`

In the image, the left is the tree and the right is the panel. Both using the same StyleBoxTexture.

I dug a bit deeper but got lost in the C++ code
# Tree.cpp
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/tree.cpp#L2774

This line looks like it's using almost  the same code as panel.cpp.

However it has this before the actual draw method is called:
```
Point2 draw_ofs;
draw_ofs += bg->get_offset();
Size2 draw_size = get_size() - bg->get_minimum_size();
```

**_Except_**  --- `draw_ofs` and `draw_size` is not being used in:
`bg->draw(ci, Rect2(Point2(), get_size()));` 

# Panel.cpp
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/panel.cpp#L35

It looks like the same code is used the only difference I see is it's using the word "bg" instead  "panel", but that doesn't matter, right?

Why is the clip happening and where is it coming from? I'm stumped :(

data.title: FileSystem tiny click space bug
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
3.0 latest compiled

**Issue description:**
There is a tiny little space between the items where if you click it doesn't register
![](https://i.gyazo.com/07babe4d8d386a1e1b8efaea597c5bfd.gif)

It actually misses the adjacent ones and deselects the item

how it should be:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/7c631d4683399be722c0f8eb635f7c3e.gif)

notice the no deselection (i'm spam clicking in the gifs)


win 7, 64-bit if that matters :D

data.title: Not found projects are grayed instead of removed at the Project Manager
data.body: Fixes #3866

data.title: Edit render priority
data.body:
`Render Priority` functionality was introduced some time ago, but currently it can not be edited or set from UI
It just displays `<null>` for any values and dont allows set values

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3992195/30258929-aa09a3e6-96e7-11e7-8741-3c90ac239fb1.png)

data.title: Implement String len()
data.body:
```
print(len("Godot"))                        # returns 5
print(len(["E", "n", "g", "i", "n", "e"])) # returns 6
```

(There are some unimplemented types/classes that can provide "length". Not sure which ones to add.)
- Vector{2,3}.length()
- RayShape(2D).get_length()
- Joints
- Quat.length()
- Animation.get_length()
- File.get_len()
etc.

data.title: Implemented DirAccess get_drive and get_drive_count for Linux
data.body: File dialog will now show the volumes on Linux.

data.title: Area2D does not report input events if it is not in a collision layer
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7 - 64bits
Godot 2.2

**Issue description:**
Area2D does not report input events if it is not in a collision layer.
I think the collision layers have nothing to do with the detection of input events so it should always detect them (when it is pickable, obviously).

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Area2D Input Bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1290967/Area2D.Input.Bug.zip) (Run with _Visible Collision Shapes_)

data.title: unregister_gdnative_types() now checks if discoverer pointer is NULL before deleting
data.body:
unregister_gdnative_types() now checks discoverer pointer to see if it is NULL
before deleting. 
Reason: When selecting a godot project to edit (Win10) in the dialog, the
discoverer_callback() wasn't called before unregister_gdnative_types() thus discoverer was NULL.

data.title: Color has no HSV / HSL Capabilities
data.body: The Color class is lacking in Hue, Saturation, and Brightness / Value controls. It's not a huge deal, but controlling HSV is (in my opinion) way more intuitive and usable when compared to directly dealing with RGB values.

data.title: Can't instantiate class from within itself
HTML5 start-up overhaul with download progress display
data.body:
Most obviously, this patch adds a download progress bar. Also comes with a spinner for indeterminate progress (when total size is unknown and during other start-up steps).
Resolves #9127

Also makes it simpler to write your own HTML page, I'll add some example HTML pages later. For now, see `/misc/dist/html/default.html`

All complex logic is hidden away in `engine.js` which is merged into `godot.js` during the build, so that the HTML file is easy to write. `engine.js` adds a simple JavaScript interface `Engine` that hides Emscripten's `Module` interface and implementation details like WebAssembly compilation, start-up memory management or main pack FS integration.

 - Implement promise-based JS interface for custom HTML page integration
 - Add download progress callback
 - Add progress bar and indeterminate spinner to default HTML page
 - Try downloading files multiple times when failing
 - Get rid of `godotfs.js`
 - Separate steps for engine initialization, game initialization and game start
 - Allow multiple games on one HTML page
 - Substitution placeholders only used in `.html` file
 - Placeholders renamed: `$GODOT_BASE` => `$GODOT_BASENAME`, `$GODOT_TMEM` -> `$GODOT_TOTAL_MEMORY`
 - Emscripten `Module` is now `Engine.RuntimeEnvironment`

data.title: Rename pos/rot/loc/scl
data.body:
Renames `pos` to `positon`, `rot` to `rotation`, `loc` to `location` and `scl` to `scale`.

See #11119.

data.title: Script access to formatted arrays and blend_arrays in meshes.
data.body: Restores ability to access mesh vertex data in a set of arrays separated by type in scripts. I was using this for a custom tool to modify and combine meshes with blend shapes, more advanced than the inbuilt tools, but since the Mesh API had changed, there was no exposed method for accessing the data in this usable form. It likewise also adds a method to the PrimitiveMesh type to access its mesh data in the same form.

data.title: Documented Transform and Transform2D.
primitive mesh + collision shape orientations
data.body:
**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
when adding a collision shape (or primitive mesh) some of them are in awkward orientations.
planes are not parallel to the ground. so when adding a plane as a floor (which I think is most usual case) it needs to be rotated (x: -90). (also bender adds planes parallel to the ground)
capsule shapes and capsule mesh are mostly used as character placeholders. but they are added sideways. (as if the character was laying on the ground) which is also inconvenient because It needs to be rotated.

**Steps to reproduce:**
add a collision shape and/or a mesh instance. try all the different collision shape resources and primitive mesh recources. some will be rotate different than what would be practical.

data.title: DirAccess constructor sets current_dir to an absolute path
data.body:
This should be a better fix for issue #11145. As per my comment in that issue:

To get symlinks working I've added support for relative path changes without resolving the actual physical directory name, which allows current_dir to never know if it is in a symlink directory or not: hence I am using this line: String next_dir = current_dir + "/" + p_dir;
So the cause of this problem is that in the constructor the initial path is relative, so I have changed this to start with an absolute path, so we should never end up with a directory name starting with "."

I did a test and this fixes the Show in File Manager button.

data.title: Add user data directory support for ProjectSettings::globalize_path
data.body: Make it possible to get full real file path in user data directory(starts with `user://` )

data.title: Use full absolute path to current current_dir in DirAccess
data.body:
fix #11145
Remmove some comments

data.title: Changed/Added descriptions in @GDScript. Added examples. Fixed return types of two
data.body: Fixed return types of two methods. is_inf and is_nan return Boolean not Float

data.title: ProjectSettings::globalize_path doesn't return full system path
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 with latest commit on Arch Linux

**Issue description:**
* The `ProjectSettings::globalize_path` always just replace `res:/` to `.` we cann't get full project path any more.
* The right mouse menu option `Show In File Manager` in filesystem dock is totally broken

data.title: Rewrite the methods section of the Thread class
[3.0] Using extends as an operator no longer works
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Bug exists on [Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-09-08.519b933](https://bintray.com/calinou/godot/editor/2017-09-08.519b933#files) and 3.0 alpha 1. 

**Issue description:**
The code `self extends Node` will give the error `Expected end of statement after expression.`. This worked in 2.1.3

data.title: Added ID to tracker signals and property for storing hand
data.body:
Added tracker ID to our tracker signals so we can detect which tracker came online. Makes it easier when adding ARVRController nodes as a response.

Also added a property to our tracker that indicates whether the controller is related to the players left or right hand, provided the SDK makes this available to us.

data.title: X11 - Adding borders back to a borderless window was not working.
data.body: When a window was started in fullscreen mode, `OS.set_borderless_window(false)` had no effect on it.

data.title: Document methods for the BoneAttachment and IP classes
data.body: Unclear if these need to be documented due to lack of replacement member variables. Documenting just in case.
